cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress. So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year. The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C), set on 2025-04-29.

heatwave.status: At present, there is no heatwave. This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves occur annually.

heaviest_rainfall.status: 13.04mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional precipitation event and ranked 8th out of our records.  A rate of 8.6mm per hour was recorded during the 7.9 hour long storm.  The heaviest total rainfall to date occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 27.64mm over the 15.9 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking 0th from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.  27.0mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded on 03 September 2025, during a 2.0 hour storm which dumped 7.99mm of rain.

storm.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 when 24.56mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 6.4mm per hour.
Active storm detected in the vicinity. This is the earliest storm we've experienced since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods. This is the first storm since August 31, 2025.

tropical: The last tropical night was July 18, 2025, with only 62 such nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (212°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 79.02 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.5 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1702 m), light levels (up 2993 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 115.7m lower than yesterday, 598.9m lower than the past week, 1702.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 713m minimum and 1594m maximum, with an average of 951.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1550.1m and 2650m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and little or no wind. Moderate rainfall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather could become unsettled.
